body:
Hello!
Im currently writing from my iPad, because something happend to my computer. ( windows 7 )
The problem is: " failure configuring windows updates, reverting changes. Do not shut down your computer "
Already checked on Microsoft support, didn't help.
Can you guys please help me?
Thanks.
body_tagged:
Hello!
Im currently writing from my iPad, because something happend to my computer. ( windows 7 )
The problem is: " failure configuring windows updates, reverting changes. Do not shut down your computer "
Already checked on Microsoft support, didn't help.
Can you guys please help me?
Thanks.
title: Help.

replies.body: I think that means windows tried to update, but something went wrong, so it is uninstalling those changes. I'm not 100% about this though. You should be fine either way it may just take some time.
replies.body_tagged: I think that means windows tried to update, but something went wrong, so it is uninstalling those changes. I'm not 100% about this though. You should be fine either way it may just take some time.

replies.body: Thanks.....I wanted to apply for staff application but i can't because this problem.
replies.body_tagged: Thanks.....I wanted to apply for staff application but i can't because this problem.

replies.body: I'm pretty sure they don't open until tomorrow at 12 est. (in about 12 hours.) So you should be fine still :)
replies.body_tagged: I'm pretty sure they don't open until tomorrow at 12 est. (in about 12 hours.) So you should be fine still :)

replies.body: In my timezone it's already 14th xD
replies.body_tagged: In my timezone it's already 14th xD

replies.body:
what system do you use??
 windows what?
replies.body_tagged:
what system do you use??
 windows what?

replies.body:
I recommend cleaning your entire PC and restoring what you need once you have done this.

You may do this by putting all of the files that you need on a large hard drive, and then re-installing all of your software.

I have had this problem with my old PC, but it worked once I did this.

Good luck with your staff application.
